between rounds 4 needle just to the right of the three loops of yarn from and 5 thread a piece of yarn pin and coming out of the bottom to top and pull the through the body starting original hole to the left repeat yarn through repeat three under a wing and coming out this two more times to create more times to create three just to the left of the pin three horizontal loops vertical loops 4 insert the needle under 5 insert the needle at the 6 tie the two ends in a knot the three vertical loops from bottom right of the beak and and hide the ends inside the left to right and pull through come out next to the yarn body squish beak into the repeat two more times to tail under the wing pull desired shape create two horizontal loops through eyes if you didn t use safety eyes you could use one of the methods below for simple child-friendly embroidered for more realistic eyes sew on a pair of eyes make three of four vertical stitches round beads pull the thread tight to embed with black embroidery thread on either side the beads slightly in the head of the beak add a horizontal stitch in white make a stitch in a lighter coloured yarn or at the top of the eye to create a highlight thread above and below each eye to surround the bead and create an eye ring you should now have a finished bird have fun experimenting with different species and colours the birds can sit upright on any flat surface alternatively you could add a hanging loop or keyring or sew a small clip or clothes peg to the underside for a perching bird 12 bonus page robin colour chart the below colour chart will make a european robin you will need yarn in 5 colours brown mid grey/blue-grey orange light beige/cream and white shift stitches should be made in the current colour note that your results may vary depending on where shift stitches are placed this chart was created with shift stitches every 4 rounds make the wings in brown note the stitches with a white border on the chart if you are using body option 3 make these stitches in brown for option 1 or 2 follow the colour chart as shown chart key 1 block = 1 stitch 1 row = 1 round work from left to right single_crochet = single_crochet increase = make 2 single_crochet in this stitch d = single_crochet 2 stitches together popcorn = popcorn shift = shift stitch at end of current row pattern by thalia evans this pattern is intended for
